Vocabularies.Definition: n.   校园
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Private automobiles are not allowed on campus.

Vocabularies.Definition: begin to have (a particular quality or appearance) 呈现，具有
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  When some metals are combined in this way, the alloy takes on new physical properties.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 机构；学校
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Hong Kong Bank is Hong Kong's largest financial institution.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   杜撰出来的人（或事）；神话
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Most societies have their own creation myths.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. that can move or be moved easily from place to place 流动的；可移动的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The mobile medical team will soon be here.

Vocabularies.Definition: take advantage of 利用，从……中得到好处
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The company cashed in on its rival's difficulties by doubling its production.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    skilful in using one's hands to make things 手巧的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Having lived in China for almost two years, Paul is now very handy with his chopsticks.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  praise publicly in order to persuade people to buy or use (sth.) 做广告，宣传
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We should advertise for someone to look after our children.

Vocabularies.Definition: be able to be summarized as 可归结为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What it comes down to is a choice between cutting wages or reducing the number of staff.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of little importance 琐碎的，不重要的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I'm sorry to bother you with such a trivial problem.

Vocabularies.Definition: order (sb.) around 将……差来差去；欺负
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I wish you would stop pushing little Jack around all the time.

Vocabularies.Definition: become used to (living in a new home, doing a new job, etc.) 开始适应，习惯于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We settled the children into new schools when we moved to London.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   the control and making of decisions in a business 管理
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The scientific management method has brought about many changes in factory production.

Vocabularies.Definition: occasionally 偶尔
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I still see my ex-wife once in a while.

Vocabularies.Definition: cause (sb.) to undergo (a test, etc.); arrange for (sb.) to complete his education 使经受（考验）；使完成学业
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He put all his children through boarding-school（寄宿制学校）.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   express a judgment on a work of art, etc. 批评，评论
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His policies were severely criticized.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.     frank and direct 直言不讳的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She is blunt about her personal life.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    an important topic for discussion or argument 问题，争论点
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What issue are Linda and her husband arguing about now?

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  extremely good; excellent 极好的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She's a fantastic swimmer.

Vocabularies.Definition: on this occasion only, as an exception 就此一次，破例一次
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Just for once he arrived on time.
